entry.title: Kiro Gligorov (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that under the rule of the first Macedonian president, Kiro Gligorov (pictured), the Republic of Macedonia was the only state that seceded from Yugoslavia peacefully?

entry.title: Richard Louhenapessy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that due to Richard Louhenapessy's arrest, the Indonesian city of Ambon had four mayors in May 2022?

entry.title: killing seven World Central Kitchen aid workers in targeted drone strikes (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Israel Defense Forces have accepted responsibility for killing seven World Central Kitchen aid workers in targeted drone strikes that destroyed the aid workers' cars one by one?

entry.title: Lester Allen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Broadway and film star Lester Allen began his career as a child acrobat in the Barnum and Bailey Circus?

entry.title: Skyrocket Galaxy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Skyrocket Galaxy has been described by NASA as looking like a "July 4th skyrocket"?

entry.title: Magdalena Hinterdobler (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a reviewer described the approach of soprano Magdalena Hinterdobler to her role as Grete in Zemlinsky's Der Traumgörge as "bold" and "sassy"?

entry.title: 33 Green Bay Packers players named to an NFL All-Rookie Team (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that of the 33 Green Bay Packers players named to an NFL All-Rookie Team since 1975, only one—James Lofton—went on to be inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame?

entry.title: Elvio Porcel de Peralta (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after being sent off for the record 97th time, footballer Elvio Porcel de Peralta went to the referee and punched him?

entry.title: C1 Espresso (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the café C1 Espresso delivers food to customers using pneumatic tubes?
